sections.heading: The Simple Rule
sections.content: は (wa) = Sets the topic/context ("Speaking of X...") が (ga) = Identifies the subject (Who/what specifically)

sections.heading: Quick Decision Guide
sections.content: Use が when: ├─ Existence (ある/いる) ├─ 好き/嫌い/できる/欲しい ├─ Answering who/what ├─ New information └─ Subordinate clauses Use は when: ├─ General statements ├─ Known information ├─ Contrasting └─ Setting context

children.heading: Example 1: Liking Things
children.content: 猫が好きです "I like cats" (Focus: what you like) 猫は好きです "Cats, I like (but maybe not dogs)" (Contrast implied)

children.heading: Example 2: Identity
children.content: 私が学生です "I am the student" (me, not others) 私は学生です "I am a student" (general fact about me)

children.heading: Example 3: Existence
children.content: 部屋に猫がいます "There's a cat in the room" (Must use が with いる) 猫は部屋にいます "The cat is in the room" (Topic: the cat)

children.heading: 1. Existence Verbs
children.content: ✓ 本があります ✗ 本はあります (wrong for existence)

children.heading: 2. Fixed Expressions
children.content: ✓ 水が欲しい (want) ✓ 日本語ができる (can) ✓ 寿司が好き (like) ✗ Cannot use は here

children.heading: 3. Question Answers
children.content: Q: 誰が来ましたか？ A: 田中さんが来ました ✓ 田中さんは来ました ✗

children.heading: 4. Subordinate Clauses
children.content: ✓ 私が買った本 ✗ 私は買った本 "The book I bought"

children.heading: 1. Explicit Contrast
children.content: ビールは飲みますが、ワインは飲みません "I drink beer but not wine" (Cannot use が)

children.heading: 2. Topic Continuation
children.content: A: 田中さんはどこですか？ B: 田中さんは図書館です (Continuing established topic)

children.heading: Scenario: Going Somewhere
children.content: 私は行きます "I will go" (neutral statement) 私が行きます "I will go" (emphasis: me, not you)

children.heading: Scenario: Weather
children.content: 雨は降りません "Rain won't fall (but maybe snow will)" 雨が降りません "It won't rain" (neutral)

sections.heading: Double Particle Sentences
sections.content:
Both in one sentence:

私は猫が好きです Topic Subject "I (topic) like cats (subject of liking)" 象は鼻が長い "Elephants (topic) have long trunks (subject)"

sections.heading: Common Patterns
sections.content: | Pattern | Particle | Example | | ------------ | -------- | -------------- | | Existence | が | 本がある | | Like/dislike | が | 寿司が好き | | Can do | が | 日本語ができる | | Want | が | 水が欲しい | | General fact | は | 犬は動物だ | | Contrast | は | ビールは飲む |

children.heading: Scenario 1: Self-Introduction
children.content: ✓ 私は田中です "I am Tanaka" (introducing yourself) ✗ 私が田中です (unless someone asked "Who's Tanaka?")

children.heading: Scenario 2: Someone Asks "Who?"
children.content: Q: 誰が学生ですか？ A: 私が学生です ✓ "I am the student"

children.heading: Scenario 3: Stating Preferences
children.content: ✓ コーヒーが好きです "I like coffee" Not: コーヒーは好きです (implies contrast)

children.heading: Scenario 4: Description
children.content: ✓ この本は面白いです "This book is interesting" (Describing the topic)

sections.heading: Most Common Mistake
sections.content:
Using は with 好き/嫌い/できる:

Wrong: 寿司は好きです ❌ Right: 寿司が好きです ✓

sections.heading: Visual Summary
sections.content: は (wa) ├─ "Speaking of X..." ├─ Sets context ├─ Known info └─ Contrast が (ga) ├─ Identifies who/what ├─ New info ├─ Answers questions └─ With ある/いる/好き/できる

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ が for existence, likes, abilities ✓ は for topics, general statements, contrast ✓ Match particles when answering questions ✓ Both can appear in same sentence ✓ Context determines which sounds natural

Deep Dive:

は (wa) - Topic Marker が (ga) - Subject Marker Topic vs Subject
